content:
Hello,

I'm still pretty green with Rust and coming from a Java background ownership is pretty foreign to me. All the same, anyway I could help I'd be more than happy to. I'd be happy to start with documentation or tests or anything else that needs getting done

Hi @Taylor Handy! If you want to contribute to the compiler or standard library, you can take a look at issues marked E-easy, or you can ask DPC. You may want to take a look at the rustc dev guide first.
Looking at the T-doc label is a good idea too, doc issues are often clear enough to start right away ! People are very helpful and will tell you when you put it in the wrong place too
Thanks for the advice, I'll take a look as soon as I'm able!
